result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Vasaturo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph A Vasaturo appeared by phone.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Joseph A Vasaturo.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 4:06 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status. Record by Atty. Daane as to approval for phone appearance by Comm. Iselin as defendant lives in South Carolina. Further record by Attorney who still needs discovery and asks for additional status. Court sets out 90 days to give attorney time. DE may appear by phone for next hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Email chain regarding status set for August 2, 2022 with Judge's Response
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

2:16 (64-06) Defendant Joseph A Vasaturo appeared by phone.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin ADA Herrmann in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Joseph A Vasaturo. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Arraignment held in open Court
Attorney Daane acknowledged receipt of the Information, waived reading plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Speedy reserved.
Requesting 60 days - Defendant is allowed to appear by phone for next STC

Judge to be assigned and STC set.

Waiver of Prelim on June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

3:15 PM (64-06) Defendant Joseph A Vasaturo not in court.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane not in court.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. 
This hearing was set at the Preliminary Hearing that was scheduled on the calendar for 05/23/2002 at 1:15PM, with no appearances by the defendant or attorney Daane. Hearing was set for today, although it does not appear notice was sent to attorney Danne or defendant. 
Court will reset Preliminary Hearing. Notices will be sent.

Hearing reset for 06/17/2022 at 2PM
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph A Vasaturo in court. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Time period waived for preliminary hearing. No victim in court. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph A Vasaturo in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Selmek, denied. Bond remains. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): D.R.C dob 3/23/2000 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
